title: Wrong data set result returned when set an invalid filter expression row[0]
description: When setting a filter like "row[0] equals to 0" or just returning a null result set, the data set returns incorrect results. The issue occurs when an invalid filter expression involving row[0] is set. According to the developer, row[0] can only be generated after all the data is fetched and cannot be used as a filter expression.
OB: When setting a filter in the data set with the expression "row[0] equals to", and then clicking on the Preview tab, the first result record is returned.
EB: The expected behavior is that row[0] cannot be used as a filter expression and an error message should be displayed to inform the user about this limitation.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Set a filter in the data set with the expression "row[0] equals to"
2. Click on the Preview tab.
